questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 subscription that uses Microsoft Teams and contains a user named User1.

Microsoft Teams has a default conferencing toll phone number of +1 234 567-8910. The default number is assigned to User1.

You need to change the conferencing toll phone number assigned to User1. The solution must meet the following requirements:

• Update the existing meeting invites of User1 to use the new conferencing toll phone number.
• Ensure that other users in your company continue to use the default number.

Which two actions should you perform? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

choices.C: From the Microsoft Teams admin center, modify the Users settings of User1.
choices.B: From the Azure Active Directory admin center, modify the Usage location of User1.
choices.E: From the Microsoft Teams admin center, modify the default Bridge settings.
choices.D: From PowerShell, run the Start-CsEXMeetingMigration cmdlet.
choices.A: From PowerShell, run the Update-csTenantMeetingUrl cmdlet.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
You are only updating one user, so wouldn't you update User1 account settings and run the update meeting cmd?

questions.question_text:
SIMULATION
-

Please wait while the virtual machine loads. Once loaded, you may proceed to the lab section. This may take a few minutes, and the wait time will not be deducted from your overall test time.

When the Next button is available, click it to access the lab section. In this section, you will perform a set of tasks in a live environment. While most functionality will be available to you as it would be in a live environment, some functionality (e.g. copy and paste, ability to navigate to external websites) will not be possible by design.

Scoring is based on the outcome of performing the tasks stated in the lab. In other words, it doesn’t matter how you accomplish the task, if you successfully perform it, you will earn credit for that task.

Labs are not timed separately, and this exam may have more than one lab that you must complete. You can use as much time as you would like to complete each lab. But you should manage your time appropriately to ensure that you are able to complete the lab(s) and all other sections of the exam in the time provided.

Please not that once you submit your work by clicking the Next button within a lab, you will NOT be able to return to the lab.

You may now click next to proceed to the lab.

Username and password.

Use the following login credentials as needed:

To enter your username, place your cursor in the Sign in box and click on the username below.

To enter your password, place your cursor in the Enter password box and click on the password below.

Microsoft 365 Username:
admin@XXXXXXXXXXX.onmicrosoft.com
Microsoft 365 Password: XXXXXXXXXXXX

If the Microsoft 365 portal does not load successfully in the browser, press CTRL-K to reload the portal in a new browser tab.

The following information is for technical support purposes only:

Lab Instance: 26178313
-


Task 1
-

Your company is opening a branch office in Miami. The office uses a network range of 10.10.10.0/24.

You need to restrict Teams bandwidth to 1,000 Kbps for all the users working at the Miami office. The solution must NOT affect other offices.

To complete this task, sign in to the Microsoft 365 portal.

discussion.content: The question is not asking about just meeting, its should be bandwidth for all voice-related traffic.

1. TAC > Locations > Network Topology > Roaming Policies tab > Add > Create Roaming policy: set Media bit rate (Kbs): 1000. 2. Network Sites tab > Add > Network Roaming policy: select the policy that you created in step 1, add Subnets: 10.10.10.0/24 of Miami office.

Refer this section in following link: CONFIGURATION OF NETWORK ROAMING BANDWIDTH POLICY

https://www.myteamslab.com/2023/03/microsoft-teams-location-based.html#:~:text=Microsoft%20Teams%20Location%20Based%20Bandwidth%20Control%20(Network%20Roaming%20Policy),-Posted%20by%20James&text=Microsoft%20Teams%20now%20has%20the,feature%20called%20Network%20Roaming%20Policy.
The solutions is confusing. I cannot find anything about roaming in Meeting policies.
How many of lab questions usually shows up in the test

comments.content: usually 8-10. it's one lab, but you have 8-10 tasks to complete in the lab

discussion.content:
Create an Audio conferencing Policy with Toronto Rank 1 and Paris Rank 2 in the Numbers.
Assign the Policy to Allan Deyoung
This does not seem to work now

Task 2
-

You need to configure only the Teams meeting invites of Allan Deyoung to first show a dial-in bridge number in Toronto, and then show a dial-in bridge number in Paris in the body of his invites.

To complete this task, sign in to the Microsoft 365 portal.

discussion.content: From Microsoft Teams client app on desktop, go to Settings > Notifications > Meeting and Calls > Toggle "Mute notifications during meetings and calls"

comments.content: Busy on Busy rejects the call though. I don't see a solution in the Teams admin portal that addresses what this lab question is requesting.
this has changed, Busy on Busy now has four options. Should just be to set Busy on Busy to On

maybe they are looking for us to using calling polices...
Configure Calling Policies:

Access the Microsoft Teams admin center.
Go to Voice > Calling policies.
Edit the applicable policy for your users.
Under Busy on busy options for calls, select Simultaneous ringing.
Under Busy on busy options for calls, uncheck the box for Also ring phones associated with simultaneous ringing.
Save the policy.
This ensures that incoming calls will ring silently in the background without interrupting the current call or meeting, and users will receive missed call notifications.

discussion.content:
The question is asking how notifications can be muted by signing in to the Microsoft 365 portal. The screenshots are for teams client.
Does it mean we need to launch the web client and mute the notifications like we do in Desktop teams client.

Task 5
-

You need to prevent incoming Teams call notifications when users are already on a Teams call or in a Teams meeting. The solution must NOT reject the call.

To complete this task, sign in to the Microsoft 365 portal.

discussion.content:
step 3 and 4 is exactly the same?
step 5 is not possible, there is no option to select Directory Search as "Redirect To" for a dial key. 
This is a feature and you just enable this feature and then select option "Dial by Name".

Task 6
-

You need to configure a virtual receptionist for your company’s main office located at 1 Microsoft Way, Redmond. The solution must meet the following requirements:

• Callers must press 1 for the company directory to lookup by name.
• Callers must press 0 to hear the company address.
• Callers must be offered the same menu at all times.

To complete this task, sign in to the Microsoft 365 portal.
